intro: Steffensia diospyrifolia, commonly known as the Florida holly, is a small evergreen shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes other acidophilous plants such as blueberries and heathers. The plant typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 feet and has glossy, dark green leaves that are elliptical in shape. It produces small, white flowers in the spring, which are followed by red, fleshy berries in the fall. Steffensia diospyrifolia is well adapted to acidic, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and coastal areas.
